bestBHT.bht: Jesus had just performed a miracle, feeding a crowd of four thousand people with only seven loaves. The disciples were in the midst of this miraculous event, so they surely could not forget what had just happened. Yet Jesus asked them how many baskets of leftovers they had collected. Their response of seven baskets indicated that they had witnessed this abundance firsthand, even though they had been previously concerned about limited provisions. This exchange serves as a reminder of Jesus' power to provide abundantly, even in times of scarcity.

John Gill: And when the seven among four thousand,.... That is, when seven loaves were broken among four thousand men."
How many baskets full of fragments took ye up? this surely you must remember, it being so recent an action, but just done, as it were.

And they said, seven; for this, as yet, could not have slipped their memories; though they had been reasoning among themselves because of their straitness of provisions, as if these things had never been done.

The disciples were in the midst of this miraculous event, so they surely could not forget what had just happened. Yet Jesus asked them how many baskets of leftovers they had collected. Their response of seven baskets indicated that they had witnessed this abundance firsthand, even though they had been previously concerned about limited provisions. Witnessing Jesus miraculously feed a crowd of four thousand people with just seven loaves, the disciples were asked by Jesus how many baskets of leftovers they had collected. This question served as a reminder for them to remember the abundance they had witnessed, as they responded with the number seven. The disciples' response indicated that even though they had been concerned about scarcity, they had not forgotten the miraculous provision of Jesus. It is a powerful testament to Jesus' ability to abundantly provide, even in times of limited resources.
